text: Robert Betts Laughlin (born November 1, 1950) is an American physicist and Professor of Physics and Applied Physics at Stanford University.Robert Laughlin – Stanford Physics Faculty. Stanford.edu. Retrieved on 2012-01-28. Along with Horst L. Störmer and Daniel C. Tsui, he was awarded a share of the 1998 Nobel Prize in physics for their explanation of the fractional quantum Hall effect. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:Living people Category:American physicists Category:Stanford University faculty Category:Scientists from Berkeley, California
title: Robert B. Laughlin
